content: Note that when b equals zero, there is no return value. Instead of a java.lang.ArithmeticException generated by the Java interpreter itself, it is an exception created by the coder. The result is the same. It shows you that an exception is an object. Its main particularity is that it can be thrown. An exception object must inherit from java.lang.Exception. Standard exceptions have two constructors:
